intro: Apteria lilacina, commonly known as the lilac-leafed apteria, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, lilac-hued leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows as a small shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of white and pink. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
